span.title: Article Title: McComb Local School Update: April 24, 2020
Article Title: McComb Local School Updated School Calendar

h3.span: McComb Local School Updated School Calendar

span.style: background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: Kindergarten screening is tentatively planned for June 2nd. This is subject to change. You will receive a phone call by May 22nd with an assigned time which must be followed, as a very limited number of individuals will be in the building. Please note that only the child being screened and a parent will be allowed in the building, entering door 1 only (by the playground). More information will be provided in the phone call.

span.style: background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Preschool screening information: A screening will be held on June 4th for all children currently on the list for preschool who will turn 4 before December, 2020. Any child turning 4 after Christmas Break of 2020 will be placed on a waiting list and screened as needed when positions open up.

In order for those currently on the list to be screened and keep a spot on the list, those children MUST attend the June 4th screening in order to remain on the list. A phone call will be made to those currently on the list to set up an exact screening time. The assigned time must then be followed as given, due to the fact that a very limited number of persons will be in the building. Only the child being screened and 1 adult will be permitted in the building during the screening time. Only door 1 (by the playground) will be used for entrance to the screening that day. Again, if you are currently on the list, you will receive a phone call with your assigned screening time by May 22nd.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: This year we’ve reviewed the 7 habits and continued to live them in our lives. Now let’s show our community!!! Make a poster about your favorite habit(s) and display it in a window at your home for people walking by or driving by to see! (Can’t decide which one is your favorite, then make/show more than one!!) If it is OK with your parents, take a picture of your poster(s) and send it to

span.style: color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: and we’ll post it on our McComb Elementary Facebook Page and our McComb School website! Can’t wait to see your posters. How many can we make by the end of May??? Keep living the habits because great habits make great leaders!
If you are having laptop issues, please email Mrs. Cawley @

a.style: color: #1155cc; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: and she will set up a time to meet you at door #1 at the school to take a look at your laptop. You are not allowed in the building, but she will meet you at the door and see if she can quickly fix your laptop, or if it's something that will take a day or so to fix.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff
div.span: She'll be available via email every weekday. She may not answer immediately, but will answer as soon as she can.

span.span: For a listing of available scholarships please check the Scholarship Google Document, available
. Many deadlines are quickly approaching! See Mrs. Becker, High School Counselor, with any questions.

h3.a: McComb Local School Update April 8, 2020: Meal Information

p.style: margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: center; background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial
p.span: Meal pick up will be every Tuesday and Thursday.

p.style: background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial
p.span: A drive thru pick-up line at school is from 11:00 am-12:00 pm (use student drop off traffic route).

p.style: background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial
p.span: A drive thru pick-up line at HYCO in Hoytville is from 11:00 am-12:00 pm.

p.style: background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial
p.span: Any children between the ages of 1-18 are eligible to receive meals.

p.style: background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial

u.span: IF YOU ALREADY SIGNED UP YOU DO NOT NEED TO CALL UNLESS YOU NO LONGER NEED MEALS OR NEED TO CHANGE YOUR PICK-UP LOCATION.

p.style: background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial
p.span: Due to preparing perishable food, anyone on the list that does NOT pick-up meals without prior notification will be removed.

p.style: text-align: center; background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial
background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial
p.span: Any changes in meals will be communicated via Ohio Alerts. Any future meal pick-up dates will be communicated via Ohio Alerts.

p.style: background-image: initial; background-size: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial
p.span: McComb School appreciates your cooperation during this time of uncertainty. Information can and likely will change frequently. Every attempt will be made to communicate changes in a timely manner.

h3.a: McComb Local School Update: April 1, 2020 Meal Information

p.span: meal pick-up is Thursday April 2, 2020 from 11:00 am-12:00 pm.
A drive thru pick-up line at school is from 11:00 am-12:00 pm (use student drop off traffic route).
A drive thru pick-up line at HYCO in Hoytville is from 11:00 am-12:00 pm.
Any children between the ages of 1-18 are eligible to receive meals.

span.u: SIGNED UP YOU DO NOT NEED TO CALL
YOU NO LONGER NEED MEALS OR NEED CHANGE YOUR PICK-UP LOCATION.

p.span: Due to preparing perishable food, anyone on the list that does NOT pick-up meals without prior notification will be removed.
Any changes in meals will be communicated via Ohio Alerts. Any future meal pick-up dates will be communicated via Ohio Alerts.
McComb School appreciates your cooperation during this time of uncertainty. Information can and likely will change frequently. Every attempt will be made to communicate changes in a timely manner.

br.span: Yesterday, Gov. DeWine extended the school closure through Friday May 1, 2020. McComb School will be continuing the meal pick-up plan as well as remote learning.

We recognize the upcoming challenges ahead within your households. As a result, McComb School will be observing “No New Instruction” days April 8-15. These dates surround the scheduled Spring Break which is April 10 and April 13.

During those days, teachers will not be assigning any new instruction, homework, assignments, etc. The “No New Instruction” days can be used for students to catch up on work, but more importantly, this time is meant for guardians/parents a time to pause, and quite frankly come up for air!
We appreciate all you are doing to assist in the learning process during these unprecedented times! Continue monitoring Ohio Alerts for updated information as well as the school’s website.
